java/liquibase/change/DeleteDataChange.java

00001 package liquibase.change;
00002 
00003 import liquibase.database.Database;
00004 import liquibase.database.sql.DeleteStatement;
00005 import liquibase.database.sql.SqlStatement;
00006 import liquibase.database.structure.DatabaseObject;
00007 import liquibase.database.structure.Table;
00008 import liquibase.exception.UnsupportedChangeException;
00009 import liquibase.exception.InvalidChangeDefinitionException;
00010 import liquibase.util.StringUtils;
00011 import org.w3c.dom.Document;
00012 import org.w3c.dom.Element;
00013 
00014 import java.util.Arrays;
00015 import java.util.HashSet;
00016 import java.util.Set;
00017 
00018 public class DeleteDataChange extends AbstractChange {
00019 
00020     private String schemaName;
00021     private String tableName;
00022     private String whereClause;
00023 
00024     public DeleteDataChange() {
00025         super("delete", "Delete Data");
00026     }
00027 
00028     public String getSchemaName() {
00029         return schemaName;
00030     }
00031 
00032     public void setSchemaName(String schemaName) {
00033         this.schemaName = StringUtils.trimToNull(schemaName);
00034     }
00035 
00036     public String getTableName() {
00037         return tableName;
00038     }
00039 
00040     public void setTableName(String tableName) {
00041         this.tableName = tableName;
00042     }
00043 
00044     public String getWhereClause() {
00045         return whereClause;
00046     }
00047 
00048     public void setWhereClause(String whereClause) {
00049         this.whereClause = whereClause;
00050     }
00051 
00052     public void validate(Database database) throws InvalidChangeDefinitionException {
00053         if (StringUtils.trimToNull(tableName) == null) {
00054             throw new InvalidChangeDefinitionException("tableName is required", this);
00055         }        
00056     }
00057 
00058     public SqlStatement[] generateStatements(Database database) throws UnsupportedChangeException {
00059 
00060         DeleteStatement statement = new DeleteStatement(getSchemaName() == null ? database.getDefaultSchemaName() : getSchemaName(), getTableName());
00061 
00062         statement.setWhereClause(whereClause);
00063 
00064         return new SqlStatement[]{
00065                 statement
00066         };
00067     }
00068 
00069     public String getConfirmationMessage() {
00070         return "Data deleted from " + getTableName();
00071     }
00072 
00073     public Element createNode(Document currentChangeLogFileDOM) {
00074         Element node = currentChangeLogFileDOM.createElement("delete");
00075         if (getSchemaName() != null) {
00076             node.setAttribute("schemaName", getSchemaName());
00077         }
00078 
00079         node.setAttribute("tableName", getTableName());
00080 
00081         if (StringUtils.trimToNull(getWhereClause()) != null) {
00082             Element whereClause = currentChangeLogFileDOM.createElement("where");
00083             whereClause.appendChild(currentChangeLogFileDOM.createTextNode(getWhereClause()));
00084             node.appendChild(whereClause);
00085         }
00086         return node;
00087     }
00088 
00089     public Set<DatabaseObject> getAffectedDatabaseObjects() {
00090         Table dbObject = new Table(getTableName());
00091 
00092         return new HashSet<DatabaseObject>(Arrays.asList(dbObject));
00093     }
00094 
00095 }
